caption.text: Shakira performing on stage in [[LINK|lang_en|Toronto|Toronto]], Canada in 2018 for her [[LINK|lang_en|El_Dorado_World_Tour|El Dorado World Tour]].

items.text: **Shakira Isabel Mebarak Ripoll** ([[LINK|lang_en|Help:IPA/English|/ʃəˈkɪərə/]], Spanish: [[LINK|lang_en|Help:IPA/Spanish|[ʃaˈkiɾa]]]; born 2 February 1977)[[CITE|5|https://archive.today/20130410141658/http://www.biography.com/people/shakira-189151]] is a Colombian singer, songwriter, dancer, businesswoman, and philanthropist. Born and raised in [[LINK|lang_en|Barranquilla|Barranquilla]], her first studio albums, *[[LINK|lang_en|Magia_(Shakira_album)|Magia]]* and *[[LINK|lang_en|Peligro_(Shakira_album)|Peligro]]*, failed to attain commercial success in the 1990s; however, she rose to prominence in Latin America with her international debut album, *[[LINK|lang_en|Pies_Descalzos|Pies Descalzos]]* (1996), and her fourth album, *[[LINK|lang_en|D%C3%B3nde_Est%C3%A1n_los_Ladrones%3F|Dónde Están los Ladrones?]]* (1998).

Shakira entered the English-language market with her fifth album, *[[LINK|lang_en|Laundry_Service|Laundry Service]]* in 2001. Its [[LINK|lang_en|Lead_single|lead single]], "[[LINK|lang_en|Whenever,_Wherever|Whenever, Wherever]]", became one of the most successful singles of 2002. Her success was solidified with her sixth and seventh albums *[[LINK|lang_en|Fijaci%C3%B3n_Oral,_Vol._1|Fijación Oral, Volumen Uno]]* and *[[LINK|lang_en|Oral_Fixation,_Vol._2|Oral Fixation, Volume Two]]* (2005). Shakira's eighth and ninth albums, *[[LINK|lang_en|She_Wolf|She Wolf]]* and *[[LINK|lang_en|Sale_el_Sol|Sale el Sol]]*, were released in 2009 and 2010 respectively. Her official song for the [[LINK|lang_en|2010_FIFA_World_Cup|2010 FIFA World Cup]], "[[LINK|lang_en|Waka_Waka_(This_Time_for_Africa)|Waka Waka (This Time for Africa)]]", which featured a South African band [[LINK|lang_en|Freshlyground|Freshlyground]], became the biggest-selling World Cup song of all time with 10 million downloads.[[CITE|6|http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/latin-notas/6106280/pitbull-shakira-poll-world-cup-song-vote]][[CITE|7|https://www.sonyatv.com/en/songwriters/741/shakira]] With over 2 billion views, it is one of the [[LINK|lang_en|List_of_most_viewed_YouTube_videos|most viewed music videos]] on YouTube. She has four of the twenty top-selling hits of the 2000s, more than any other artist.[[CITE|8|https://www.sony.com/en_us/SCA/company-news/press-releases/epic-records/2010/shakira-releases-sale-el-sol-the-sun-comes-out-tod.html]][[CITE|9|http://rocnation.com/shakira/]]

[[LINK|lang_en|List_of_awards_and_nominations_received_by_Shakira|Shakira has received numerous awards]], including 3 [[LINK|lang_en|Grammy_Award|Grammy Awards]], 13 [[LINK|lang_en|Latin_Grammy_Awards|Latin Grammy Awards]], 4 [[LINK|lang_en|MTV_Video_Music_Awards|MTV Video Music Awards]], 7 [[LINK|lang_en|Billboard_Music_Awards|Billboard Music Awards]], 39 [[LINK|lang_en|Billboard_Latin_Music_Awards|Billboard Latin Music Awards]] and has been [[LINK|lang_en|Golden_Globe|Golden Globe]]-nominated. She has a star on the [[LINK|lang_en|Hollywood_Walk_of_Fame|Hollywood Walk of Fame]] and sold more than 75 million records worldwide, making her one of the [[LINK|lang_en|List_of_best-selling_music_artists|world's best-selling music artists]].[[CITE|10|https://www.houstonpress.com/music/women-who-should-be-in-the-rock-and-roll-hall-of-fame-11274035]] She is a goodwill ambassador for [[LINK|lang_en|UNICEF|UNICEF]].
Early life

Born on 2 February 1977 in [[LINK|lang_en|Barranquilla|Barranquilla]], Colombia, she is the only child of William Mebarak Chadid and Nidia Ripoll Torrado. Her paternal grandparents emigrated from [[LINK|lang_en|Lebanon|Lebanon]] to New York City, where her father was born.[[CITE|11|https://books.google.com/?id=5MK7XpItx-wC&pg=PA20]][[CITE|12|https://books.google.com/?id=3kIdcLYGmCYC&pg=PT6]][[CITE|13|https://books.google.com/books?id=_rVji23NYM0C]][[CITE|14|https://books.google.com/?id=ETO3VaCXT4IC&pg=PA11]] Her father then emigrated to Colombia at age 5. The name *Shakira* ([[LINK|lang_en|Arabic_language|Arabic]]: شاكرة‎) is Arabic for "grateful", the feminine form of the name *[[LINK|lang_en|Shakir|Shakir]]* ([[LINK|lang_en|Arabic_language|Arabic]]: شاكر‎).  From her mother, she has Spanish ([[LINK|lang_en|Catalan_people|Catalan]] and [[LINK|lang_en|Castilian_people|Castilian]])[[CITE|15|https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fshzEmNXBM8]][[CITE|16|http://numberonestars.com/shakira/shakira_interviews_5.htm]] and Italian[[CITE|17|http://articles.latimes.com/2006/aug/17/news/wk-shakira17]] ancestry. She was raised [[LINK|lang_en|Catholic_Church|Catholic]] and attended Catholic schools.[[CITE|18|http://www.bet.com/celebrities/photos/2014/04/catholic-celebrities.html#!041614-celebs-catholics-shakira]] She has eight older half-siblings from her father's previous marriage.[[CITE|19|http://entertainment.timesonline.co.uk/tol/arts_and_entertainment/music/article5802815.ece]] Shakira spent much of her youth in Barranquilla, a city located on the northern Caribbean coast of Colombia, and wrote her first poem, titled "La Rosa De Cristal/The Crystal Rose", when she was only four years old. As she was growing up, she was fascinated watching her father writing stories on a [[LINK|lang_en|Typewriter|typewriter]], and asked for one as a Christmas gift. She got that typewriter at the age of seven, and has continued writing poetry since then. These poems eventually evolved into songs. When Shakira was two years old, an older half-brother was killed in a motorcycle accident; six years later, at the age of eight, Shakira wrote her first song, titled "Tus gafas oscuras/Your dark glasses", which was inspired by her father, who for years wore dark glasses to hide his grief.[[CITE|20|http://www.redbalcony.com/?aid=167]]

When Shakira was four, her father took her to a local Middle Eastern restaurant, where Shakira first heard the [[LINK|lang_en|Doumbek|doumbek]], a traditional drum used in [[LINK|lang_en|Arabic_music|Arabic music]] and which typically accompanied [[LINK|lang_en|Belly_dancing|belly dancing]].[[CITE|21|https://www.rollingstone.com/artists/shakira/articles/story/5937750/shakira]] She started dancing on the table, and the experience made her realize that she wanted to be a performer. She enjoyed singing for schoolmates and teachers (and even the nuns) at her Catholic school, but in second grade, she was rejected for the school choir because her [[LINK|lang_en|Vibrato|vibrato]] was too strong. The music teacher told her that she sounded "like a goat".[[CITE|21|https://www.rollingstone.com/artists/shakira/articles/story/5937750/shakira]][[CITE|22|http://news.bbc.co.uk/cbbcnews/hi/music/newsid_1890000/1890956.stm]] At school, she was often sent out of the class because of her [[LINK|lang_en|Hyperactivity|hyperactivity]] (ADHD).[[CITE|23|http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/06/16/shakira-jimmy-kimmel_n_3447912.html]] She says she had also been known as "the belly dancer girl", as she would demonstrate every Friday at school a number she had learned.[[CITE|21|https://www.rollingstone.com/artists/shakira/articles/story/5937750/shakira]] "That's how I discovered my passion for live performance," she says.[[CITE|19|http://entertainment.timesonline.co.uk/tol/arts_and_entertainment/music/article5802815.ece]]
To instill gratitude in Shakira for her upbringing, her father took her to a local park to see orphans who lived there. The images stayed with her, and she said to herself: "One day I'm going to help these kids when I become a famous artist."[[CITE|19|http://entertainment.timesonline.co.uk/tol/arts_and_entertainment/music/article5802815.ece]]

Between the ages of 10 and 13, Shakira was invited to various events in Barranquilla and gained some recognition in the area.[[CITE|24|http://www.gale.com/free_resources/chh/bio/shakira.htm]] It was at this approximate time that she met local theater producer Monica Ariza, who was impressed with her and as a result tried to help her career. During a flight from Barranquilla to [[LINK|lang_en|Bogot%C3%A1|Bogotá]], Ariza convinced [[LINK|lang_en|Sony|Sony]] Colombia executive Ciro Vargas to hold an audition for Shakira in a hotel lobby. Vargas held Shakira in high regard and, returning to the Sony office, gave the cassette to a song and artist director. However, the director was not overly excited and thought Shakira was something of "a lost cause". Undaunted and still convinced that Shakira had talent, Vargas set up an audition in Bogotá. He arranged for Sony Colombia executives to arrive at the audition, with the idea of surprising them with Shakira's performance. She performed three songs for the executives and impressed them enough for her to be signed to record three albums.[[CITE|25|http://www.vh1.com/shows/dyn/driven/96614/episode_about.jhtml]]
Career
1990–1995: Beginnings

Shakira's debut album, *[[LINK|lang_en|Magia_(Shakira_album)|Magia]]*, was recorded with [[LINK|lang_en|Sony_Music_Entertainment|Sony Music Colombia]] in 1990 when she was only 13 years old.[[CITE|26|http://shakira-bio.tumblr.com/]] The songs are a collection made by her since she was eight, mixed [[LINK|lang_en|Pop-rock|pop-rock]] [[LINK|lang_en|Ballad|ballads]] and [[LINK|lang_en|Disco|disco]] uptempo songs with electronic accompaniment. The album was released in June 1991 and featured "Magia" and three other singles. Though it fared well on Colombian radio and gave the young Shakira much exposure, the album did not fare well commercially, as only 1,200 copies were sold worldwide.[[CITE|21|https://www.rollingstone.com/artists/shakira/articles/story/5937750/shakira]] After the poor performance of *Magia*, Shakira's label urged her to return to the studio to release a follow-up record. Though she was little known outside of her native Colombia at the time, Shakira was invited to perform at Chile's [[LINK|lang_en|Vi%C3%B1a_del_Mar_International_Song_Festival|Viña del Mar International Song Festival]] in February 1993. The festival gave aspiring Latin American singers a chance to perform their songs, and the winner was then chosen by a panel of judges. Shakira performed the ballad "Eres" ("You Are") and won the trophy for third place. One of the judges who voted for her to win was the then 20-year-old [[LINK|lang_en|Ricky_Martin|Ricky Martin]],[[CITE|26|http://shakira-bio.tumblr.com/]] whose initial prominence had come from his membership in [[LINK|lang_en|Menudo_(band)|Menudo]].

Shakira's second studio album, titled *[[LINK|lang_en|Peligro_(Shakira_album)|Peligro]]*, was released in March, but Shakira was not pleased with the final result, mainly taking issue with the production. The album was better received than *Magia* had been, though it was also considered a commercial failure due to Shakira's refusal to advertise or promote it. Shakira then decided to take a hiatus from recording so that she could graduate from high school.[[CITE|26|http://shakira-bio.tumblr.com/]] In the same year, Shakira starred in the Colombian TV series *The Oasis*, loosely based on the [[LINK|lang_en|Armero_tragedy|Armero tragedy]] in 1985.[[CITE|27|http://www.mtv.com/music/artist/shakira/artist.jhtml]] Since then, the albums have been pulled from release and are not considered official Shakira albums but rather promotional albums. Shakira originally recorded the song "[[LINK|lang_en|%C2%BFD%C3%B3nde_Est%C3%A1s_Coraz%C3%B3n%3F|¿Dónde Estás Corazón?]]" (later released on her album *Pies Descalzos*) for the compilation album *Nuestro Rock* in 1995, released exclusively in Colombia.[[CITE|28|http://www.songfacts.com/detail.php?id=1751]] The album *Pies Descalzos* brought her great popularity in Latin America by the hit singles "Estoy Aquí", "Pies Descalzos, Sueños Blancos" and "Dónde Estás Corazón".[[CITE|26|http://shakira-bio.tumblr.com/]] Shakira also recorded three tracks in Portuguese, titled "Estou Aqui", "Um Pouco de Amor", and "Pés Descalços".
1995–2000: Latin breakthrough

Shakira returned to recording music under Sony Music along with [[LINK|lang_en|Columbia_Records|Columbia Records]] in 1995 with Luis F. Ochoa, using musical influences from a number of countries and an [[LINK|lang_en|Alanis_Morissette|Alanis Morissette]]-oriented persona which affected two of her next albums.[[CITE|29|https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2006/08/30/AR2006083003265.html]]  These recordings spawned her third studio album, and her international debut album, titled *[[LINK|lang_en|Pies_Descalzos|Pies Descalzos]]*. Recording for the album began in February 1995, after the success of her single "¿Dónde Estás Corazón?" Sony gave Shakira $100,000 to produce the album since they predicted that the album would not sell past 100,000 copies.

The album, *[[LINK|lang_en|Pies_Descalzos|Pies Descalzos]]*, was released in February 1996. It only managed to reach number one-hundred-eighty on the U.S. [[LINK|lang_en|Billboard_200|*Billboard* 200]] but reached number five on the U.S. [[LINK|lang_en|Billboard_Top_Latin_Albums|Billboard Top Latin Albums]] chart. The album spawned six hit singles, "[[LINK|lang_en|Estoy_Aqu%C3%AD|Estoy Aquí]]", which reached number two on the U.S. Latin chart, "[[LINK|lang_en|%C2%BFD%C3%B3nde_Est%C3%A1s_Coraz%C3%B3n%3F|¿Dónde Estás Corazón?]]" which reached number five on the U.S. Latin chart, "[[LINK|lang_en|Pies_Descalzos,_Sue%C3%B1os_Blancos|Pies Descalzos, Sueños Blancos]]" which reached number 11 on the U.S. Latin chart, "[[LINK|lang_en|Un_Poco_de_Amor|Un Poco de Amor]]" which reached number six on the U.S. Latin chart, "[[LINK|lang_en|Antolog%C3%ADa_(Shakira_song)|Antología]]" which reached number 15 on the U.S. Latin chart, and "[[LINK|lang_en|Se_quiere,_Se_Mata|Se quiere, Se Mata]]" which reached number eight on the U.S. Latin chart.[[CITE|30|https://www.billboard.com/music/shakira/chart-history/]] In August 1996, [[LINK|lang_en|RIAA|RIAA]] certified the album platinum status.[[CITE|31|http://riaa.com/goldandplatinumdata.php?resultpage=1&table=SEARCH_RESULTS&action=&title=PiesDescalzos&artist=&format=&debutLP=&category=&sex=&releaseDate=&requestNo=&type=&level=&label=&company=&certificationDate=&awardDescription=&catalogNo=&aSex=&rec_id=&charField=&gold=&platinum=&multiPlat=&level2=&certDate=&album=&id=&after=&before=&startMonth=1&endMonth=1&startYear=1958&endYear=2009&sort=Artist&perPage=25]]

In March 1996, Shakira went on to her first international tour, named simply the *[[LINK|lang_en|Tour_Pies_Descalzos|Tour Pies Descalzos]]*. The tour consisted of 20 shows and ended in 1997. Also in that year, Shakira received three [[LINK|lang_en|Billboard_Latin_Music_Awards|Billboard Latin Music Awards]] for Album of the Year for *Pies Descalzos*, Video of the Year for "Estoy Aqui", and [[LINK|lang_en|Best_New_Artist|Best New Artist]].[[CITE|32|http://www.europanas.com/shakira-en.htm]] *Pies Descalzos* later sold over 5 million copies,[[CITE|33|http://ssmusic.tv/artist_profile.php?Opt=2&Language=&artId=20070600001]][[CITE|34|http://www.shakira.com/discography/index/album/albumId/1/tagName/Albums]] prompting the release of a remix album, simply titled *The Remixes*. *The Remixes* also included [[LINK|lang_en|Portuguese_language|Portuguese]] versions of some of her well-known songs, which were recorded as a result of her success in the Brazilian market, where *Pies Descalzos* sold nearly one million copies.[[CITE|24|http://www.gale.com/free_resources/chh/bio/shakira.htm]]

Her fourth studio album was titled *[[LINK|lang_en|D%C3%B3nde_Est%C3%A1n_los_Ladrones%3F|Dónde Están los Ladrones?]]* This, produced entirely by Shakira herself and [[LINK|lang_en|Emilio_Estefan,_Jr.|Emilio Estefan, Jr.]] as the executive producer, was released in September 1998. The album, inspired by an incident in an airport in which a suitcase filled with her written lyrics was stolen, became a bigger hit than *Pies Descalzos*. The album has reached a peak position of number 131 on the U.S. *Billboard* 200 and held the top spot on the U.S. Latin Albums chart for 11 weeks. It has since sold over 7 million copies worldwide[[CITE|35|https://www.lavanguardia.com/gente/20090202/53631993197/la-cantante-colombiana-shakira-cumple-32-anos.html]] and 1.5 million copies in the U.S. alone, making it one of the best selling Spanish albums in the U.S. Eight singles were taken from the album including "[[LINK|lang_en|Ciega,_Sordomuda|Ciega, Sordomuda]]", "[[LINK|lang_en|Moscas_En_La_Casa|Moscas En La Casa]]", and "[[LINK|lang_en|No_Creo|No Creo]]", which became her first single to chart on the U.S. *Billboard* [[LINK|lang_en|Billboard_Hot_100|*Billboard* Hot 100]], "[[LINK|lang_en|Inevitable_(song)|Inevitable]]", "[[LINK|lang_en|T%C3%BA_(song)|Tú]]", "[[LINK|lang_en|Si_Te_Vas_(Shakira_song)|Si Te Vas]]", "[[LINK|lang_en|Octavo_d%C3%ADa|Octavo día]]", and "[[LINK|lang_en|Ojos_As%C3%AD|Ojos Así]]".

Shakira also received her first [[LINK|lang_en|Grammy_Award|Grammy Award]] nomination in 1999 for [[LINK|lang_en|Grammy_Award_for_Best_Latin_Rock/Alternative_Album|Best Latin Rock/Alternative Album]].[[CITE|36|http://product.half.ebay.com/Donde-Estan-Los-Ladrones_W0QQtgZinfoQQprZ3295362]] Shakira's first live album, *[[LINK|lang_en|MTV_Unplugged_(Shakira_album)|MTV Unplugged]]*, was recorded in New York City on 12 August 1999. Highly acclaimed by American critics, it is rated as one of her best-ever live performances.[[CITE|37|https://www.allmusic.com/album/r467215]] In March 2000, Shakira embarked on her *[[LINK|lang_en|Tour_Anfibio|Tour Anfibio]]*, a two-month tour of Latin America and the United States. In August 2000, she won an [[LINK|lang_en|MTV_Video_Music_Award|MTV Video Music Award]] in the category of People's Choice – Favorite International Artist for "Ojos Así". In September 2000, Shakira performed "Ojos Así" at the inaugural ceremony of the [[LINK|lang_en|Latin_Grammy_Awards|Latin Grammy Awards]], where she was nominated in five categories: [[LINK|lang_en|Latin_Grammy_Award_for_Album_of_the_Year|Album of the Year]] and [[LINK|lang_en|Latin_Grammy_Award_for_Best_Pop_Vocal_Album,_Female|Best Pop Vocal Album]] for *MTV Unplugged*, Best Female Rock Vocal Performance for "Octavo Día", [[LINK|lang_en|Best_Female_Pop_Vocal_Performance|Best Female Pop Vocal Performance]] and [[LINK|lang_en|Latin_Grammy_Award_for_Best_Short_Form_Music_Video|Best Short Form Music Video]] for the video for "Ojos Así".[[CITE|38|http://www.bmi.com/news/entry/232776]]
2001–2004: English transition with *Laundry Service*

Upon the success of *Dónde Están los Ladrones?* and *MTV Unplugged*, Shakira began working on an English [[LINK|lang_en|Crossover_album|crossover album]].[[CITE|39|http://articles.latimes.com/1999/apr/18/entertainment/ca-28407]] She learned English with the help of [[LINK|lang_en|Gloria_Estefan|Gloria Estefan]].[[CITE|40|https://www.latintimes.com/gloria-estefan-reveals-she-taught-shakira-how-speak-english-her-2001-laundry-service-album-136631]] She worked for over a year on new material for the album. "[[LINK|lang_en|Whenever,_Wherever|Whenever, Wherever]]", called "[[LINK|lang_en|Whenever,_Wherever|Suerte]]" in Spanish-speaking countries, was released as the first and lead single from her first English album and fifth studio album throughout the period between August 2001 and February 2002. The song took heavy influence from [[LINK|lang_en|Andean_music|Andean music]], including the [[LINK|lang_en|Charango|charango]] and [[LINK|lang_en|Panpipes|panpipes]] in its instrumentation. It became an international success by reaching number one in most countries. It was also her first success in the U.S., by reaching number six on the Hot 100.

Shakira's fifth studio album and first English language album, titled *[[LINK|lang_en|Laundry_Service|Laundry Service]]* in English-speaking countries and *Servicio De Lavanderia* in Latin America and Spain, was released on 13 November 2001. The album debuted at number three on the U.S. *Billboard* 200 chart, selling over 200,000 records in its first week. The album was later certified triple platinum by the RIAA in June 2004 as well.[[CITE|41|http://billboard.biz/bbbiz/search/article_display.jsp?vnu_content_id=1000509297]] It helped to establish Shakira's musical presence in the mainstream North American market. Seven singles were taken from the album such as "Whenever, Wherever"/"Suerte", "[[LINK|lang_en|Underneath_Your_Clothes|Underneath Your Clothes]]", "[[LINK|lang_en|Objection_(Tango)|Objection (Tango)]]"/"[[LINK|lang_en|Te_Aviso,_Te_Anuncio_(Tango)|Te Aviso, Te Anuncio (Tango)]]", "[[LINK|lang_en|The_One_(Shakira_song)|The One]]", "[[LINK|lang_en|Te_Dejo_Madrid|Te Dejo Madrid]]", "[[LINK|lang_en|Que_Me_Quedes_T%C3%BA|Que Me Quedes Tú]]", and "[[LINK|lang_en|Poem_to_a_Horse|Poem to a Horse]]".

Because the album was created for the English-language market, the rock and Spanish dance-influenced album gained mild critical success, with some critics claiming that her English skills were too weak for her to write songs for it; *[[LINK|lang_en|Rolling_Stone|Rolling Stone]]*, for one, stated that "she sounds downright silly" or "Shakira's magic is lost in translation".[[CITE|42|https://www.rollingstone.com/music/albumreviews/laundry-service-20011017]] A similar view was expressed by Elizabeth Mendez Berry in "[[LINK|lang_en|Vibe_(magazine)|Vibe]]": "While her Spanish-language albums sparkled with elegant wordplay, this record is rife with cliches, both musically and lyrically. [...] For Anglophone Latin lovers, Shakira's lyrics are best left to the imagination."[[CITE|43|https://openlibrary.org/search?q=Elizabeth%20Mendez%20Berry.%20%22Shakira.%20Laundry%20Service%22]] Despite this fact, the album became the best selling album of 2002, selling more than 20 million copies worldwide.[[CITE|26|http://shakira-bio.tumblr.com/]][[CITE|44|http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/shakira-and-enrique-iglesias-join-line-up-for-live-earth-hamburg-58272932.html]][[CITE|45|http://www.bmi.com/musicworld/entry/535199]][[CITE|46|http://shakira.com/]] and became the most successful album of her career to date. The album earned her the title as the biggest Latin female crossover artist in the world.[[CITE|47|http://fcaua.com/index.php?option=com_listing&task=view&id=116&Itemid=12]] Around this time, Shakira also released four songs for [[LINK|lang_en|Pepsi|Pepsi]] for her promotion in the English markets: "Ask for More", "Pide Más", "Knock on My Door", and "Pídeme el Sol".

In 2002, at [[LINK|lang_en|Aerosmith|Aerosmith]]'s [[LINK|lang_en|MTV_Icon|MTV Icon]] in April 2002, Shakira performed "[[LINK|lang_en|Dude_(Looks_Like_a_Lady)|Dude (Looks Like a Lady)]]". She also joined [[LINK|lang_en|Cher|Cher]], [[LINK|lang_en|Whitney_Houston|Whitney Houston]], [[LINK|lang_en|Celine_Dion|Celine Dion]], [[LINK|lang_en|Mary_J._Blige|Mary J. Blige]], [[LINK|lang_en|Anastacia|Anastacia]], and the [[LINK|lang_en|Dixie_Chicks|Dixie Chicks]] for *[[LINK|lang_en|VH1_Divas_Live_Las_Vegas|VH1 Divas Live Las Vegas]]*. In September, she won the International Viewer's Choice Award at the MTV Video Music Awards with "Whenever, Wherever". She also won the [[LINK|lang_en|Latin_Grammy_Award|Latin Grammy Award]] for the category of [[LINK|lang_en|Best_Short_Form_Music_Video|Best Short Form Music Video]] for the Spanish version of the video. In October, she won five [[LINK|lang_en|MTV_Video_Music_Awards_Latin_America|MTV Video Music Awards Latin America]] for Best Female Artist, Best Pop Artist, Best Artist – North (Region), Video of the Year (for "Suerte"), and Artist of the Year. In November, she embarked on the [[LINK|lang_en|Tour_of_the_Mongoose|Tour of the Mongoose]] with 61 shows occurring by May 2003. The tour was also her first worldwide tour, as legs were played in North America, South America, Europe and Asia. Shakira's label, Sony BMG, also released her Spanish greatest-hits compilation, *[[LINK|lang_en|Grandes_%C3%89xitos_(Shakira_album)|Grandes Éxitos]]*. A DVD and 10-track live album, titled *[[LINK|lang_en|Live_%26_Off_the_Record|Live & Off the Record]]*, was also released in 2004, commemorating the Tour of the Mongoose.

caption.text: Shakira before entering the stage to her [[LINK|lang_en|Tour_of_the_Mongoose|Tour of the Mongoose]] in 2003

items.text: 2005–2007: *Fijación Oral, Volumen Uno* and *Oral Fixation, Volume Two*

Shakira's sixth studio album, *[[LINK|lang_en|Fijaci%C3%B3n_Oral,_Vol._1|Fijación Oral, Volumen Uno]]*, was released in June 2005. The lead single from the album, "[[LINK|lang_en|La_Tortura|La Tortura]]", reached the top 40 on the Hot 100. The song also featured the Spanish balladeer [[LINK|lang_en|Alejandro_Sanz|Alejandro Sanz]]. Shakira became the first artist to perform a Spanish language song at the *MTV Video Music Awards* in 2005. The album was extremely well received. It debuted at number four on the *Billboard* 200 chart, selling 157,000 copies in its first week. It has since sold over two million copies in the U.S., earning an 11× Platinum (Latin field) certification from the RIAA. Due to its first week sales, the album became the highest debut ever for a Spanish language album. After only a day of release in Latin America, the album earned certifications. In Venezuela, it earned a Platinum certification, in Colombia, a triple Platinum certification, while in Mexico demand exceeded shipments and the album was unavailable after only one day of release. Four other singles were also released from the album: "[[LINK|lang_en|No_(Shakira_song)|No]]", "[[LINK|lang_en|D%C3%ADa_de_Enero|Día de Enero]]", "[[LINK|lang_en|La_Pared_(Shakira_song)|La Pared]]", and "[[LINK|lang_en|Las_de_la_Intuici%C3%B3n|Las de la Intuición]]". *Fijación Oral, Vol. 1* has since sold over four million copies worldwide.[[CITE|48|http://www.ticket4-you.com/acatalog/Shakira.html]] On 8 February 2006, Shakira won her second Grammy Award with the win of *Best Latin Rock/Alternative Album* for *Fijación Oral, Vol. 1*.[[CITE|49|http://www.grammy.org/recording-academy/awards]] She received four Latin Grammy Awards in November 2006, winning the awards for [[LINK|lang_en|Latin_Grammy_Award_for_Record_of_the_Year|Record of the Year]], [[LINK|lang_en|Latin_Grammy_Award_for_Song_of_the_Year|Song of the Year]] for "La Tortura", [[LINK|lang_en|Latin_Grammy_Award_for_Album_of_the_Year|Album of the Year]] and [[LINK|lang_en|Latin_Grammy_Award_for_Best_Pop_Vocal_Album,_Female|Best Pop Vocal Album]] for *Fijación Oral, Vol. 1*.[[CITE|50|http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2006/11/02/entertainment/main2147901.shtml]]

The lead single for Shakira's seventh album, *[[LINK|lang_en|Oral_Fixation,_Vol._2|Oral Fixation, Vol. 2]]*, "[[LINK|lang_en|Don%27t_Bother|Don't Bother]]", failed to achieve chart success in the U.S. by missing the top 40 on the Hot 100. It did, however, reach the top 20 in most countries worldwide. Shakira's second English studio album and seventh studio album, *Oral Fixation, Vol. 2*, was released on 29 November 2005. The album debuted at number five on the *Billboard* 200, selling 128,000 copies in its first week. The album has gone on to sell 1.8 million records in the U.S., and over eight million copies worldwide.[[CITE|51|http://www.shakira.com/discography/index/album/albumId/4/tagName/Albums]]

Despite the commercial failure of the album's lead single in the U.S., it went on to spawn two more singles. "[[LINK|lang_en|Hips_Don%27t_Lie|Hips Don't Lie]]", which featured [[LINK|lang_en|Wyclef_Jean|Wyclef Jean]], was released as the album's second single in February 2006. It would become Shakira's first number one single on the *Billboard* Hot 100, in addition to reaching number one in over 55 countries. Shakira and Wyclef Jean also recorded a Bamboo version of the song to serve as the closing ceremony song of the [[LINK|lang_en|FIFA_World_Cup_2006|FIFA World Cup 2006]]. Shakira later released the third and final single from the album, "[[LINK|lang_en|Illegal_(song)|Illegal]]", which featured [[LINK|lang_en|Carlos_Santana|Carlos Santana]], in November 2006. She then embarked on the [[LINK|lang_en|Oral_Fixation_Tour|Oral Fixation Tour]], which began in June 2006. The tour consisted of 125 shows between June 2006 and July 2007 and visited six continents. In February 2007, Shakira performed for the first time at the [[LINK|lang_en|49th_Grammy_Awards|49th Grammy Awards]] and earned the nomination for [[LINK|lang_en|Best_Pop_Collaboration_with_Vocals|Best Pop Collaboration with Vocals]] for "Hips Don't Lie" with Wyclef Jean.

In late 2006, Shakira and [[LINK|lang_en|Alejandro_Sanz|Alejandro Sanz]] collaborated for the duet "[[LINK|lang_en|Te_lo_Agradezco,_Pero_No|Te lo Agradezco, Pero No]]", which is featured on Sanz's album *[[LINK|lang_en|El_Tren_de_los_Momentos|El Tren de los Momentos]]*. The song was a top ten hit in Latin America, and topped the *Billboard* Hot Latin Tracks chart. Shakira also collaborated with [[LINK|lang_en|Miguel_Bos%C3%A9|Miguel Bosé]] on the duet "[[LINK|lang_en|Si_T%C3%BA_No_Vuelves|Si Tú No Vuelves]]", which was released in Bosé's album *[[LINK|lang_en|Papito_(album)|Papito]]*. In early 2007, Shakira worked with American [[LINK|lang_en|R%26B|R&B]] singer [[LINK|lang_en|Beyonc%C3%A9|Beyoncé]] Knowles for the track "[[LINK|lang_en|Beautiful_Liar|Beautiful Liar]]", which was released as the second single from the deluxe edition of Beyoncé's album *[[LINK|lang_en|B%27Day_(Beyonc%C3%A9_album)|B'Day]]*. In April 2007, the single jumped 91 positions, from 94 to three, on the *Billboard* Hot 100 chart, setting the record for the largest upward movement in the history of the chart at the time. It was also number one on the official [[LINK|lang_en|UK_Singles_Chart|UK Singles Chart]]. The song earned them a [[LINK|lang_en|Grammy_Award|Grammy Award]] nomination for [[LINK|lang_en|Best_Pop_Collaboration_with_Vocals|Best Pop Collaboration with Vocals]]. Shakira was also featured on [[LINK|lang_en|Annie_Lennox|Annie Lennox]]'s song "[[LINK|lang_en|Sing_(Annie_Lennox_song)|Sing]]", from the album *[[LINK|lang_en|Songs_of_Mass_Destruction|Songs of Mass Destruction]]*, which also features other 23 other female singers.[[CITE|52|http://www.contactmusic.net/annie-lennox/news/fascinating-fact-3595_1037950]] In late 2007, Shakira and Wyclef Jean recorded their second duet, "King and Queen". The song was featured on Wyclef Jean's 2007 album *[[LINK|lang_en|Carnival_Vol._II:_Memoirs_of_an_Immigrant|Carnival Vol. II: Memoirs of an Immigrant]]*.

Shakira wrote the lyrics, and jointly composed the music, for two new songs that are featured in the movie *[[LINK|lang_en|Love_in_the_Time_of_Cholera_(film)|Love in the Time of Cholera]]*, based on the acclaimed novel written by Colombian author [[LINK|lang_en|Gabriel_Garc%C3%ADa_M%C3%A1rquez|Gabriel García Márquez]]. García Marquez himself asked Shakira to write the songs.[[CITE|53|http://www.shakiramedia.com/articles/detail/2081]] The songs that Shakira lent to the soundtrack were "Pienso en ti", a song from Shakira's breakthrough album *Pies Descalzos*, "Hay Amores", and "Despedida". "Despedida" was nominated for Best Original Song at the [[LINK|lang_en|65th_Golden_Globe_Awards|65th Golden Globe Awards]].

caption.text: Shakira performing at the [[LINK|lang_en|Rock_in_Rio|Rock in Rio]] festival in 2006

items.text: In early 2008, [[LINK|lang_en|Forbes|Forbes]] named Shakira the fourth top-earning female artist in music industry.[[CITE|54|https://www.forbes.com/2008/01/28/music-madonna-hollywood-biz-cz_dp_0129musicwomen.html]] Then, in July of that year, Shakira signed a $300 million contract with [[LINK|lang_en|Live_Nation_Entertainment|Live Nation]], an international touring giant, which contract was to remain in effect for ten years.[[CITE|55|https://www.nytimes.com/2008/07/02/arts/music/02shakira-brief.html]][[CITE|56|http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/thr-esq/shakira-sued-100-million-by-438840]] The touring group also doubles as a record label which promotes, but does not control, the music its artists release. Shakira's contract with [[LINK|lang_en|Epic_Records|Epic Records]] called for three more albums as well – one in English, one in Spanish, and a compilation, but the touring and other rights of the Live Nation deal were confirmed to begin immediately.

In January 2009, Shakira performed at the [[LINK|lang_en|Lincoln_Memorial|Lincoln Memorial]] "[[LINK|lang_en|We_Are_One:_The_Obama_Inaugural_Celebration_at_the_Lincoln_Memorial|We Are One]]" festivities in honor of the inauguration of President [[LINK|lang_en|Barack_Obama|Barack Obama]]. She performed "[[LINK|lang_en|Higher_Ground_(Stevie_Wonder_song)|Higher Ground]]" with [[LINK|lang_en|Stevie_Wonder|Stevie Wonder]] and [[LINK|lang_en|Usher_(entertainer)|Usher]].[[CITE|57|http://www.variety.com/review/VE1117939371.html?categoryid=1264&cs=1]] *[[LINK|lang_en|She_Wolf|She Wolf]]*, was released in October 2009 internationally and on 23 November 2009 in the U.S. The album received mainly positive reviews from critics, and was included in AllMusic's year-end "Favorite Albums,"[[CITE|58|http://www.allmusic.com/blog/post/allmusics-favorite-albums-of-2009/]] "Favorite Latin Albums,"[[CITE|59|http://www.allmusic.com/blog/post/allmusics-favorite-latin-albums-of-2009]] and "Favorite Pop Albums" lists.[[CITE|60|http://www.allmusic.com/blog/post/allmusics-favorite-pop-albums-of-2009]]
*She Wolf* reached number one on the charts of Argentina, Ireland, Italy, Mexico and Switzerland. It also charted inside the top five in Spain, Germany and the United Kingdom. It debuted at number fifteen on the [[LINK|lang_en|Billboard_200|*Billboard* 200]]. *She Wolf* was [[LINK|lang_en|Record_certification|certified]] double-platinum in Colombia and Mexico, platinum in Italy and Spain, and gold in numerous countries including France and the United Kingdom. The album sold 2 million copies worldwide, becoming one of Shakira's least successful studio album to date in terms of sales.[[CITE|61|https://www.bbc.co.uk/music/reviews/dq8r]]

In May, Shakira collaborated with the South African group [[LINK|lang_en|Freshlyground|Freshlyground]] to create the official song of the [[LINK|lang_en|2010_FIFA_World_Cup|2010 FIFA World Cup]] in South Africa. "[[LINK|lang_en|Waka_Waka_(This_Time_for_Africa)|Waka Waka (This Time for Africa)]]", which is based on a traditional Cameroonian soldiers's [[LINK|lang_en|Fang_language|Fang]] song titled "[[LINK|lang_en|Zamina_mina_(Zangalewa)|Zangalewa]]" by the group Zangalewa or [[LINK|lang_en|Golden_Sounds|Golden Sounds]].[[CITE|62|http://thelede.blogs.nytimes.com/2010/05/24/shakira-remixes-african-hit-for-world-cup/]] The single later reached the top 20 in Europe, South America and Africa and the top 40 in the U.S. and was performed by Shakira at the World Cup kick-off and closing. It became the biggest-selling World Cup song of all time.[[CITE|63|http://www.aolradioblog.com/2010/04/27/shakira-records-offical-song-2010-fifa-world-cup/]][[CITE|64|https://www.fifa.com/aboutfifa/worldwideprograms/news/newsid=1330342.html#shakira+scoops+prestigious+mtv+award]]

caption.text: Shakira at the [[LINK|lang_en|Rock_in_Rio|Rock in Rio]] festival in 2008

items.text: 2010–2015: *Sale el Sol* and *Shakira*

In October 2010, Shakira released her ninth studio album, titled *[[LINK|lang_en|Sale_el_Sol|Sale el Sol]]*. The album received critical acclaim and was included in AllMusic's "Favorite Albums of 2010" and "Favorite Latin Albums of 2010" year-end lists.[[CITE|65|http://www.allmusic.com/blog/post/allmusics-favorite-albums-of-2010/]][[CITE|66|http://www.allmusic.com/blog/post/allmusics-favorite-latin-albums-of-2010]] At the [[LINK|lang_en|Latin_Grammy_Awards_of_2011|2011]] [[LINK|lang_en|Latin_Grammy_Awards|Latin Grammy Awards]] ceremony, *Sale el Sol* was nominated for "[[LINK|lang_en|Latin_Grammy_Award_for_Album_of_the_Year|Album of the Year]]" and "[[LINK|lang_en|Latin_Grammy_Award_for_Best_Female_Pop_Vocal_Album|Best Female Pop Vocal Album]]", winning the award in the latter category.[[CITE|67|http://www.latingrammy.com/en/nominees/search?artist=Shakira&field_nominee_work_value=&year=2011&genre=All]]
Commercially the album was a success throughout Europe and Latin America, *Sale el Sol* peaked atop the charts of countries Belgium, Croatia, France, Mexico, Portugal and Spain. In the United States, it debuted at number seven on the US [[LINK|lang_en|Billboard_200|*Billboard* 200]] chart marking the highest debut for a Latin album for the year[[CITE|68|https://books.google.com/books?id=xGl78gyjknMC&pg=RA5-PA74&dq=sale+el+sol+first+week+sales+nielsen+soundscan&hl=en&sa=X&ei=5SkeUqzBLsGVrgfbqYHADw&redir_esc=y#v=onepage&q=sale%20el%20sol%20first%20week%20sales%20nielsen%20soundscan&f=false]] and was Shakira's fifth album to peak at number one.[[CITE|69|http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/467273/shakira-is-latin-grammy-person-of-the-year]] According to *Billboard*, 35% of its first-week sales were credited to strong digital sales.[[CITE|68|https://books.google.com/books?id=xGl78gyjknMC&pg=RA5-PA74&dq=sale+el+sol+first+week+sales+nielsen+soundscan&hl=en&sa=X&ei=5SkeUqzBLsGVrgfbqYHADw&redir_esc=y#v=onepage&q=sale%20el%20sol%20first%20week%20sales%20nielsen%20soundscan&f=false]] The album also peaked at number one on both the [[LINK|lang_en|Billboard_Top_Latin_Albums|Top Latin Albums]] and [[LINK|lang_en|Latin_Pop_Albums|Latin Pop Albums]] charts, achieving strong digital sales in the region.  The lead single, "[[LINK|lang_en|Loca_(Shakira_song)|Loca]]", was number one in many countries. The album had sold over 1 million copies worldwide in 6 weeks,[[CITE|70|https://www.twitter.com/SonyMusic/statuses/11820972751454208]] and over 4 million since its release.[[CITE|71|http://www.chartsinfrance.net/Shakira/news-71899.html]]

In September, Shakira embarked on [[LINK|lang_en|The_Sun_Comes_Out_World_Tour|The Sun Comes Out World Tour]], in support of her two most recent albums. The tour visited countries in North America, Europe, South America, Asia, and Africa with 107 shows in all. The tour was met with positive reactions from critics, who praised Shakira's stage presence and energy during her performances. On 9 November 2011, Shakira was honored as [[LINK|lang_en|Latin_Recording_Academy_Person_of_the_Year|Latin Recording Academy Person of the Year]] and performed a cover of [[LINK|lang_en|Joe_Arroyo|Joe Arroyo]]'s song "En Barranquilla Me Quedo" at the [[LINK|lang_en|Mandalay_Bay_Events_Center|Mandalay Bay Events Center]] as a tribute to the singer, who had died earlier that year.[[CITE|72|http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/465205/shakira-honored-as-latin-grammy-person-of-the-year]][[CITE|73|http://www.elheraldo.co/tendencias/emotivo-tributo-a-shakira-como-persona-del-a-o-45341]] In 2010 Shakira collaborated with rapper [[LINK|lang_en|Pitbull_(entertainer)|Pitbull]] for the song "[[LINK|lang_en|Get_It_Started|Get It Started]]", which was slated to be the lead single from Pitbull's upcoming album, *Global Warming*. The single was released on 28 June 2012.[[CITE|74|http://www.digitalspy.ca/music/news/a389474/shakira-pitbull-collaboration-get-it-started-leaks-online-listen.html]] She was also signed to [[LINK|lang_en|Roc_Nation|Roc Nation]] under management purposes for her upcoming studio album.[[CITE|75|http://www.shakiramedia.com/news/detail/1071]]

On 17 September 2012, it was announced that Shakira and [[LINK|lang_en|Usher_(entertainer)|Usher]] would replace [[LINK|lang_en|Christina_Aguilera|Christina Aguilera]] and [[LINK|lang_en|CeeLo_Green|CeeLo Green]] for the fourth season of the U.S. TV show *[[LINK|lang_en|The_Voice_(U.S._season_4)|The Voice]]*, alongside [[LINK|lang_en|Adam_Levine|Adam Levine]] and [[LINK|lang_en|Blake_Shelton|Blake Shelton]]. Shakira announced that she would focus on her new album in the fall and eventually returned for the show's [[LINK|lang_en|The_Voice_(U.S._season_6)|sixth season]] in February 2014.

Shakira originally planned to release her new album in 2012, but due to her pregnancy, plans to release the single and video were postponed.[[CITE|76|http://www.josepvinaixa.com/blog/shakira-i-dare-you-single-preview/]][[CITE|77|http://www.elheraldo.co/tendencias/escuche-30-segundos-de-la-nueva-cancion-de-shakira-que-esta-grabando-en-lisboa-73085]]
In December 2013, it was announced that Shakira's new single had been delayed until January 2014.[[CITE|78|http://au.news.yahoo.com/a/20285847/rihanna-teams-with-shakira-for-duet/]][[CITE|79|http://www.eltiempo.com/elenco/shakira-y-rihanna-hacen-una-cancion_13254221-4]]
Shakira's [[LINK|lang_en|Shakira_(album)|self-titled tenth studio album]] was later released on 25 March 2014. Commercially the album debuted at number two on the US [[LINK|lang_en|Billboard_200|*Billboard* 200]] chart with first week sales of 85,000 copies. By doing so, *Shakira* became the singer's highest-charting album on the chart, although it also achieved her lowest first-week sales figure (for an English-language album).
The album spawned three singles.
After release the first two singles from the album, "[[LINK|lang_en|Can%27t_Remember_to_Forget_You|Can't Remember to Forget You]]" and "[[LINK|lang_en|Empire_(Shakira_song)|Empire]]".[[CITE|80|http://www.popjustice.com/thenews/shakiras-next-single-is-called-empire-and-might-be-online-quite-soon/124722/]] [[LINK|lang_en|RCA_Records|RCA]] chose "Dare (La La La)" as third single.[[CITE|81|http://www.earone.it/news/shakira_dare_la_la_la_radio_date_28_03_2014_10095045/]][[CITE|82|http://www.radioairplay.fm/RadioDate/PublicDetails/61970]] The [[LINK|lang_en|One_Love,_One_Rhythm_%E2%80%93_The_2014_FIFA_World_Cup_Official_Album|World Cup]] version was officially released on 27 May to impact radio stations, features [[LINK|lang_en|Brazilian_people|Brazilian]] musician [[LINK|lang_en|Carlinhos_Brown|Carlinhos Brown]]. On 13 July 2014, Shakira performed "[[LINK|lang_en|Dare_(La_La_La)|La La La (Brazil 2014)]]" with Carlinhos Brown at the [[LINK|lang_en|2014_FIFA_World_Cup_closing_ceremony|2014 FIFA World Cup closing ceremony]] at the [[LINK|lang_en|Maracan%C3%A3_Stadium|Maracanã Stadium]].[[CITE|83|http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/latin-notas/6157520/shakira-delivers-winning-performance-at-world-cup-closing-ceremony-fifa-santana-wyclef-alexandre-pires]] This performance became her third consecutive appearance at the FIFA World Cup.[[CITE|84|https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/news/y=2014/m=7/news=musical-superstars-to-wow-audience-at-fifa-world-cuptm-final-2398191.html]][[CITE|85|http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/6150203/shakira-la-la-la-world-cup-closing-ceremony]]

caption.text: Shakira performing at the [[LINK|lang_en|We_Are_One:_The_Obama_Inaugural_Celebration_at_the_Lincoln_Memorial|We Are One: The Obama Inaugural Celebration at the Lincoln Memorial]] in 2009
Shakira at a press conference for the [[LINK|lang_en|2014_FIFA_World_Cup|2014 FIFA World Cup]] closing ceremony

items.text: 2016–present: *El Dorado*

Shakira sang the song 'Try Everything' for the movie Zootopia released in 10 February 2016. Shakira began work on her eleventh studio album in the beginning of 2016.[[CITE|86|http://www.youthhealthmag.com/articles/39508/20160218/shakira-new-album-2016.htm]] In May 2016, she collaborated with Colombian singer [[LINK|lang_en|Carlos_Vives|Carlos Vives]] on the track "[[LINK|lang_en|La_Bicicleta|La Bicicleta]]." On 28 October 2016, Shakira released the single "[[LINK|lang_en|Chantaje|Chantaje]]" with Colombian singer [[LINK|lang_en|Maluma_(singer)|Maluma]]; though the song was a track from Shakira's upcoming eleventh studio album, it was not intended to be the lead single.[[CITE|87|http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/latin/7557702/shakira-chantaje-maluma-listen]] The song became Shakira's most-viewed YouTube video, with over 2.1 billion views as of 1 June 2018. On 7 April 2017, Shakira released the song "[[LINK|lang_en|Me_Enamor%C3%A9_(Shakira_song)|Me Enamoré]]" as the second official single taken from her eleventh studio album *[[LINK|lang_en|El_Dorado_(Shakira_album)|El Dorado]],* which was released on 26 May 2017. Shakira also released the song "Perro Fiel" as a promotional single for the album on 25 May 2017.[[CITE|88|http://www.elsalvador.com/entretenimiento/famosos/354604/nicky-jam-la-sorpresa-en-el-nuevo-album-de-shakira/]] Its official release as the third single took place on 15 September 2017, the same date its music video, which was filmed in Barcelona on 27 July 2017, was released.[[CITE|89|http://www.directlyrics.com/shakira-premieres-perro-fiel-music-video-with-nicky-jam-watch-news.html]] Before being released as a single, was certified gold in Spain for selling over 20,000 copies on 30 August 2017.[[CITE|90|http://www.elportaldemusica.es/cancion-14442-25809-shakira-nicky-jam-perro-fiel]]

In January 2018, Shakira won her third [[LINK|lang_en|Grammy_Award|Grammy Award]] for [[LINK|lang_en|Grammy_Award_for_Best_Latin_Pop_Album|Best Latin Pop Album]] for her album [[LINK|lang_en|El_Dorado_(Shakira_album)|El Dorado]],[[CITE|91|http://www.shakira.com/news/1071]] making her the only female Latin artist to do so. She celebrated this with the release of the single Trap ft. [[LINK|lang_en|Maluma_(singer)|Maluma]].

The [[LINK|lang_en|El_Dorado_World_Tour|El Dorado World Tour]] was announced on 27 June 2017,[[CITE|92|https://twitter.com/shakira/status/879671218676387840]] through Shakira's official Twitter account, and was slated to be sponsored by [[LINK|lang_en|Rakuten|Rakuten]].[[CITE|93|http://www.shakira.com/news/1025]] Other announced partners of the tour were [[LINK|lang_en|Live_Nation_Entertainment|Live Nation Entertainment]]'s Global Touring Division (which had previously collaborated with Shakira on her [[LINK|lang_en|The_Sun_Comes_Out_World_Tour|The Sun Comes Out World Tour]]) and [[LINK|lang_en|Citigroup|Citi]], which the press release named as, respectively, the producer and the credit card for the North American leg of the tour.[[CITE|94|http://investors.livenationentertainment.com/news-center/news-center-details/2017/Shakira-Announces-EL-DORADO-WORLD-TOUR-Presented-by-Rakuten/default.aspx]]

The tour, it was announced, would begin on 8 November, in [[LINK|lang_en|Cologne|Cologne]], Germany. But due to voice-strain related problems the singer experienced during her tour rehearsals, the date was cancelled one day before the original tour schedule, and it was announced that it would be rescheduled for a later date.[[CITE|95|http://www.shakira.com/news/1056]] On 9 November, for the same reason, she also announced the postponements to later dates, to be determined and announced, for both shows in Paris, as well as the following ones in [[LINK|lang_en|Antwerp|Antwerp]] and [[LINK|lang_en|Amsterdam|Amsterdam]].[[CITE|96|https://www.facebook.com/shakira/posts/10156058942169560]] On 14 November, Shakira made an announcement, through her social networks, in which she revealed that she had suffered a haemorrhage on her right vocal cord in late October, at her last series of rehearsals, and that she thus needed to rest her voice for some time to recover; this forced the postponement of the tour's entire European itinerary to 2018.

The Latin American dates were expected to be announced later, when the tour resumed.[[CITE|93|http://www.shakira.com/news/1025]] There were plans to bring the tour, when it did resume, to countries such as the [[LINK|lang_en|Dominican_Republic|Dominican Republic]].[[CITE|97|http://elnacional.com.do/shakira-incluye-rd-en-el-dorado-world-tou/]] In addition, a journalist from the Brazilian edition of the Portuguese newspaper *[[LINK|lang_en|Destak|Destak]]* announced, on his Twitter account, that the Colombian singer would visit [[LINK|lang_en|Brazil|Brazil]] the following March.[[CITE|98|https://twitter.com/jnflesch/status/917469544859529217]] However, according to the same newspaper, due to Shakira's hiatus to recover from her vocal-cord haemorrhage, the Latin American dates were also postponed to the second half of 2018.[[CITE|99|https://twitter.com/destak/status/940184576919556097?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw&ref_url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.portalshakira.com%2Fshakira-adiou-turne-no-brasil%2F]] Eventually, Shakira did recover fully from the haemorrhage she had suffered and resumed her tour, performing in [[LINK|lang_en|Hamburg|Hamburg]], Germany on 3 June 2018.

In January 2018 she announced the finalized dates for her [[LINK|lang_en|El_Dorado_World_Tour|El Dorado World Tour]]. She began the first leg of her tour in Europe, starting in [[LINK|lang_en|Hamburg|Hamburg]], Germany on 3 June and then ending in [[LINK|lang_en|Barcelona|Barcelona]], Spain on 7 July. She then spent a short time in Asia on the 11 and 13 July, after which she went to North America. She started her time there on 3 August in Chicago and finished in San Francisco on 7 September. In May 2018, she confirmed and announced her final tour dates for Latin America, starting off in [[LINK|lang_en|Mexico_City|Mexico City]] on 11 October and finished her tour in [[LINK|lang_en|Bogot%C3%A1|Bogota]], Colombia on 3 November.
Artistry

On her music, Shakira has said that, "my music, I think, is a fusion of many different elements. And I'm always experimenting. So I try not to limit myself, or put myself in a category, or... be the architect of my own jail."[[CITE|100|https://www.rollingstone.com/artists/shakira/articles/story/5931811/qa_shakira]] Shakira has frequently stated she is inspired by [[LINK|lang_en|Music_of_Asia|oriental music]] and Indian music, which influenced many of her earlier works.[[CITE|101|http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/5313228.stm]] She has also been influenced by her Arabian heritage, which was a major inspiration for her breakthrough world hit "[[LINK|lang_en|Ojos_As%C3%AD|Ojos Así]]". She told Portuguese TV, "Many of my movements belong to Arab culture." She also cites her parents as having been major contributors to her musical style.[[CITE|102|http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/4406486.stm]] She is also strongly influenced by [[LINK|lang_en|Andean_music|Andean music]] and South American [[LINK|lang_en|Folk_music|folk music]], using her native instrumentation for her Latin dance-pop songs.[[CITE|103|http://www.thecelebezine.com/s/Shakira]]

Her earlier Spanish albums, including *[[LINK|lang_en|Pies_Descalzos|Pies Descalzos]]* and *[[LINK|lang_en|D%C3%B3nde_Est%C3%A1n_los_Ladrones%3F|Dónde Están los Ladrones?]]* were a mix of folk music and Latin rock.
Her cross-over English album, *[[LINK|lang_en|Laundry_Service|Laundry Service]]* and later albums were influenced by [[LINK|lang_en|Pop_rock|pop rock]] and [[LINK|lang_en|Pop_Latino|pop Latino]].[[CITE|104|https://www.rollingstone.com/artists/shakira/albums/album/314397/review/5941112/laundry_service]] "Laundry Service" is primarily a [[LINK|lang_en|Pop_rock|pop rock]] album, but also draws influences from a variety of musical genres.[[CITE|105|https://portal.issn.org/resource/ISSN/0006-2510]] The singer credited this to her mixed ethnicity, saying: "I am a fusion. That's my persona. I'm a fusion between black and white, between pop and rock, between cultures – between my Lebanese father and my mother's Spanish blood, the Colombian folklore and [[LINK|lang_en|Arab_dance|Arab dance]] I love and American music."[[CITE|106|http://www.faze.ca/issue07/shakira.html]]

The [[LINK|lang_en|Arabic_music|Arabian]] and Middle Eastern elements that exerted a high influence on *Dónde Están los Ladrones?*[[CITE|106|http://www.faze.ca/issue07/shakira.html]] are also present in *Laundry Service*, most prominently on "Eyes Like Yours"/"Ojos Así".[[CITE|107|http://www.allmusic.com/album/laundry-service-mw0000016418]] Musical styles from different South American countries surface on the album. [[LINK|lang_en|Tango_(music)|Tango]], a style of fast-paced [[LINK|lang_en|Ballroom_dance|ballroom dance]] that originated in [[LINK|lang_en|Argentina|Argentina]], is evident on "Objection (Tango)", which also combines elements of [[LINK|lang_en|Rock_and_roll|rock and roll]].[[CITE|105|https://portal.issn.org/resource/ISSN/0006-2510]] The [[LINK|lang_en|Uptempo|uptempo]] track features a guitar solo and a bridge in which Shakira delivers [[LINK|lang_en|Rapping|rap]]-like vocals.[[CITE|108|https://www.theguardian.com/music/2002/mar/08/popandrock.shopping]]

*She Wolf* is primarily an [[LINK|lang_en|Electropop|electropop]] album that combines influences from the musical styles of various countries and regions, like Africa, Colombia, India, and the Middle East.[[CITE|109|http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/267379/shakira-the-she-wolf-billboard-cover-story]][[CITE|110|http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1616583/shakira-new-album-very-electronic.jhtml]] Shakira termed the album as a "sonic experimental trip", and said that she researched [[LINK|lang_en|Folk_music|folk music]] from different countries in order to "combine electronics with world sounds, tambourines, clarinets, [[LINK|lang_en|Music_of_Asia|oriental]] and [[LINK|lang_en|Hindu_music|Hindu]] music, dancehall, etc."[[CITE|111|http://archive.shakira.com/discography/index/album/albumId/21/tagName/Albums]]
Her 2010 album, *[[LINK|lang_en|Sale_el_Sol|Sale el Sol]]*, is a return to her beginnings containing ballads, rock songs, and Latin dance songs like "[[LINK|lang_en|Loca_(Shakira_song)|Loca]]".[[CITE|112|https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/shakira-plans-november-release-for-sale-el-sol-2060107.html]][[CITE|113|http://www.sonymusic.de/Shakira/Sale-El-Sol/P/2428016]]

Shakira stated that [[LINK|lang_en|John_Lennon|John Lennon]] was her number one and biggest music influence.[[CITE|114|http://inflooenz.com/?artist=shakira&submit=Search]] As a child, Shakira was influenced by rock music, listening heavily to rock bands like [[LINK|lang_en|Led_Zeppelin|Led Zeppelin]],[[CITE|115|https://www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle/2002/jun/08/shopping.colombia]] [[LINK|lang_en|The_Beatles|The Beatles]], [[LINK|lang_en|Nirvana_(band)|Nirvana]], [[LINK|lang_en|The_Police|The Police]] and [[LINK|lang_en|U2|U2]],[[CITE|116|http://www.mtv.com/music/artist/shakira/artist.jhtml]] while her other influences included [[LINK|lang_en|Gloria_Estefan|Gloria Estefan]], [[LINK|lang_en|Madonna_(entertainer)|Madonna]], [[LINK|lang_en|Sheryl_Crow|Sheryl Crow]], [[LINK|lang_en|Alanis_Morissette|Alanis Morissette]], [[LINK|lang_en|Marc_Anthony|Marc Anthony]], [[LINK|lang_en|Meredith_Brooks|Meredith Brooks]] and [[LINK|lang_en|The_Cure|The Cure]].[[CITE|117|http://www.dailynews.lk/2009/01/24/fea21.pdf]][[CITE|118|http://www.mtv.com/artists/shakira/related-artists/?filter=influencedBy]]
Dance

Shakira is well known for her dancing in various music videos and in concert. Her moves are based on the art of [[LINK|lang_en|Belly_dancing|belly dancing]], a part of her [[LINK|lang_en|Lebanese_people|Lebanese]] heritage. She often performs [[LINK|lang_en|Barefoot|barefoot]]; Shakira says she learned this form of dance as a young teen to overcome her shyness. She also mentioned in a MTV interview that she learned how to belly dance by trying to flip a coin with her belly.[[CITE|119|http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/showbiz/music/2660085/Shakira-spills-toned-tum-secret.html]][[CITE|120|http://www.contactmusic.com/new/xmlfeed.nsf/mndwebpages/shakiras%20belly%20dancing%20discovery_27_01_2006]]

Shakira's distinctive dancing style is said to be unique to her in the industry that combines Middle Eastern belly dance with Latin dancing. Her hip shaking is mentioned in songs, like [[LINK|lang_en|Fifth_Harmony|Fifth Harmony]]’s “Brave Honest Beautiful”.[[CITE|121|https://www.huffpost.com/entry/fifth-harmony-impersonations_n_6614580]]
Achievements

Shakira has received numerous awards and recognition for her work. Shakira has sold more than 75 million records worldwide.[[CITE|10|https://www.houstonpress.com/music/women-who-should-be-in-the-rock-and-roll-hall-of-fame-11274035]]
Nielsen Broadcast Data Systems said that "[[LINK|lang_en|Hips_Don%27t_Lie|Hips Don't Lie]]" was the most-played pop song in a single week in American radio history. It was played 9,637 times in one week. Shakira became the first artist in the history of the *Billboard* charts to earn the coveted number one spots on both the [[LINK|lang_en|Top_40_Mainstream|Top 40 Mainstream]] and [[LINK|lang_en|Latin_Pop_Airplay|Latin Chart]] in the same week doing so with "Hips Don't Lie".[[CITE|122|http://www.contactmusic.com/new/xmlfeed.nsf/mndwebpages/shakira%20scores%20most-played%20record_05_06_2006]] Additionally, she is the only artist from South America to reach the number-one spot on the U.S. *Billboard* Hot 100, the Australian [[LINK|lang_en|ARIA_Charts|ARIA]] chart, and the [[LINK|lang_en|UK_Singles_Chart|UK Singles Chart]].[[CITE|123|https://www.bbc.co.uk/music/artists/bf24ca37-25f4-4e34-9aec-460b94364cfc]]

Her song "[[LINK|lang_en|La_Tortura|La Tortura]]" at one time held the record for Billboard's Hot Latin Tracks chart, appearing at number-one more than any other single with a total of 25 non-consecutive weeks, a record currently held by the [[LINK|lang_en|Enrique_Iglesias|Enrique Iglesias]] song "[[LINK|lang_en|Bailando_(Enrique_Iglesias_song)|Bailando]]" with 41 weeks.[[CITE|124|http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/6297021/enrique-iglesias-bailando-breaks-record-hot-latin-songs]]
[[LINK|lang_en|Nokia|Nokia]] stated in 2010, that there were more Shakira music downloads in the prior year than for any other Latino artist in the last five years, and *[[LINK|lang_en|She_Wolf_(Shakira_song)|She Wolf]]* topped the Top 10 Latino downloads.[[CITE|125|http://www.themusicmagazine.co.uk/shakira-most-downloaded-latin-artist]] In 2010, she was ranked number five on the 'Online Video's Most Viral Artists of 2010' with 404,118,932 views.[[CITE|126|http://www.billboard.biz/bbbiz/others/year-end-online-video-s-most-viral-artists-1004134449.story]] She has become a YouTube sensation having surpassed 14 billion views on the website with "[[LINK|lang_en|Chantaje|Chantaje]] accounting for over 2.2 billion views and "[[LINK|lang_en|Waka_Waka_(This_Time_for_Africa)|Waka Waka]]" accounting for over 2 billion views, and her channel is currently the [[LINK|lang_en|List_of_most_subscribed_users_on_YouTube|45th most subscribed on YouTube]].

In 2011, Shakira was honored at the [[LINK|lang_en|Latin_Grammys|Latin Grammys]] as 2011's [[LINK|lang_en|Latin_Recording_Academy_Person_of_the_Year|Latin Recording Academy Person of the Year]].[[CITE|127|http://b96.radio.com/2011/11/10/photos-shakira-honored-as-2011-latin-recording-academy-person-of-the-year/]] She also received a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame located at 6270 Hollywood Blvd.[[CITE|128|http://archive.shakira.com/news/title/shakira-to-be-honored-with-star-on-the-hollywood-walk-of-fame]][[CITE|129|http://shakiramedia.com/news/detail/1045]] Originally, she was to be given a star on the [[LINK|lang_en|Hollywood_Walk_of_Fame|Hollywood Walk of Fame]] in 2004, but she turned the offer down.[[CITE|130|http://breakingnews.iol.ie/entertainment/?jp=mhgbgbididsn]] In 2012, she received the honor of [[LINK|lang_en|Ordre_des_Arts_et_des_Lettres|Chevalier De L'Ordre des Arts et des Lettres]].[[CITE|131|http://archive.shakira.com/news/title/shakira-wins-ordre-des-arts-et-des-lettres-award-]] In 2014, Shakira became the first musical act to perform three times at the FIFA World Cup.[[CITE|85|http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/6150203/shakira-la-la-la-world-cup-closing-ceremony]] In the same year, [[LINK|lang_en|Aleiodes_shakirae|Aleiodes shakirae]], a new species of parasitic wasp was named after her[[CITE|132|https://www.bbc.co.uk/music/articles/bd76e141-7f21-4eba-86e9-61a06225a23a]] because it causes its host to “shake and wiggle” [[CITE|133|https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/scitech/science/360679/new-wasp-species-named-after-shakira-for-its-dance-inducing-larvae/story/]]

In 2018 [[LINK|lang_en|Spotify|Spotify]] included Shakira in the list of top 10 most streamed female artists of the decade on the platform, making her the highest streamed Latin artist.[[CITE|134|https://newsroom.spotify.com/2018-10-10/celebrating-a-decade-of-discovery-on-spotify/]]

caption.text: Statue of Shakira at [[LINK|lang_en|Barranquilla|Barranquilla]], Colombia in March 2008

items.text: Monuments

In 2006 A 6 tone, 16-foot tall statue of Shakira designed by the German artist Dieter Patt was installed in Shakira's hometown [[LINK|lang_en|Barranquilla|Barranquilla]] in  the park near  [[LINK|lang_en|Estadio_Metropolitano_Roberto_Mel%C3%A9ndez|Estadio Metropolitano Roberto Meléndez]],where Shakira performed in during her [[LINK|lang_en|Oral_Fixation_Tour|Oral Fixation Tour]].[[CITE|135|http://www.colombia.travel/en/where-to-go/caribbean/barranquilla/activities/shakira-monument]] In July 2018 Shakira visited [[LINK|lang_en|Tannourine|Tannourine]] in [[LINK|lang_en|Lebanon|Lebanon]] which is the village of her paternal grandmother. During her visit Shakira visited the Cedars Reserve in Tannourine, where a square in the forest was named after her, holding the name “Shakira Isabelle Mebarak” [[CITE|136|https://en.annahar.com/article/831443-shakira-joins-the-cedars-in-her-hometown-tannourine]]
Legacy

Shakira is a prominent figure in Latin music, and her crossover to the global market is outsdanding that *[[LINK|lang_en|The_New_York_Times|The New York Times]]* has titled her as the "Titan of Latin Pop" for her unique and leading position in Latin music saying "Shakira is a titan of Latin pop. Even as a new generation of Spanish-speaking artists are crossing over into American music’s mainstream, Shakira’s output stands alone.” [[CITE|137|https://www.nytimes.com/2018/08/03/arts/this-week-in-arts-shakira-battery-dance-festival-the-sinner.html]] Moreover, *[[LINK|lang_en|Forbes|Forbes]]* has deemed Shakira as “crossover phenom” for her unmatched success of crossover [[CITE|138|https://www.forbes.com/2008/01/28/music-madonna-hollywood-biz-cz_dp_0129musicwomen.html#73b1e2cb67b3]] and one of the world's most powerful Latinas.[[CITE|139|https://www.forbes.com/pictures/ffhm45kgl/shakira-3/#6564cd546283]] Her unprecedented crossover has inspired other Latin American artists to attempt crossing over, one example is Mexican pop star [[LINK|lang_en|Paulina_Rubio|Paulina Rubio]], having *[[LINK|lang_en|MTV|MTV]]* saying "there's no question that Shakira opened doors in this country for artists like Rubio to succeed."[[CITE|140|http://www.mtv.com/news/1453550/paulina-rubio-hoping-to-cross-over-border-like-shakira/]] After the crossover, her global and mainstream presence became big enough for [[LINK|lang_en|Time_(magazine)|*TIME*]] magazine to call Shakira a “pop legend.” [[CITE|141|http://time.com/4948533/shakira-trevor-noah-carpool/]]

Many artists have cited Shakira as their idol or inspiration and have been influenced by her, artists like [[LINK|lang_en|Beyonc%C3%A9|Beyoncé]],[[CITE|142|https://m.eonline.com/ar/news/948452/10-celebridades-que-son-grandes-fanaticas-de-otras-celebridades]] [[LINK|lang_en|Rihanna|Rihanna]],[[CITE|143|https://www.legit.ng/59085.html]] [[LINK|lang_en|Lauren_Jauregui|Lauren Jauregui]],[[CITE|144|https://www.etonline.com/fifth-harmonys-lauren-jauregui-her-cultural-identity-and-self-confidence-i-love-who-i-am-exclusive]][[LINK|lang_en|Ellen_Degeneres|Ellen Degeneres]],[[CITE|145|https://twitter.com/theellenshow/status/692116540792147974?lang=en]] [[LINK|lang_en|Rita_Ora|Rita Ora]],[[CITE|146|https://www.dailystar.co.uk/showbiz/rehab/270439/Rita-Ora-s-hot-right-now-for-Shakira]] [[LINK|lang_en|Justin_Bieber|Justin Bieber]],[[CITE|147|https://colombiareports.com/justin-bieber-shakira/]] [[LINK|lang_en|Maluma_(singer)|Maluma]],[[CITE|148|https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/latin/8347120/shakira-maluma-interview-billboard-cover-story-2018]] [[LINK|lang_en|Karol_G|Karol G]],[[CITE|149|https://us.hola.com/celebrities/2019040222587/karol-g-hola-usa-interview/]] [[LINK|lang_en|Natti_Natasha|Natti Natasha]],[[CITE|150|http://www.wradio.com.co/noticias/sociedad/natti-natasha-se-siente-ganadora-simplemente-por-competir-con-shakira-y-jlo/20160206/nota/3054644.aspx]] [[LINK|lang_en|Lele_Pons|Lele Pons]],[[CITE|151|https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/8473621/lele-pons-meets-shakira]] [[LINK|lang_en|Carla_Morrison|Carla Morrison]],[[CITE|152|https://www.eluniversal.com.mx/articulo/espectaculos/musica/2016/09/9/carla-morrison-yo-quiero-ser-fuerte-como-shakira]] [[LINK|lang_en|Andres_Cuervo|Andres Cuervo]].[[CITE|153|https://peopleenespanol.com/article/andres-cuervo-estrena-el-video-de-destino-o-casualidad/]]
Other ventures

Shakira has ventured into many other businesses and industries. She appeared in the Colombian [[LINK|lang_en|Telenovela|telenovela]] *El Oasis* in 1994, playing the character of Luisa Maria.[[CITE|154|https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0320907/]]

Shakira began her own beauty line, "[[LINK|lang_en|S_by_Shakira|S by Shakira]]", with parent company [[LINK|lang_en|Puig_(company)|Puig]], in 2010.[[CITE|155|http://www.puig.com/#/en_GB/people.success-stories:people.success-story-detail:people.success-story-detail/8]]
Among the first perfumes it released included "S by Shakira" and "S by Shakira Eau Florale", along with lotions and body sprays. As of 2019, she has released 30 fragrances, not counting deluxe editions.[[CITE|156|https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Shakira.html]] On 17 September 2015, she was featured as a playable bird in the game [[LINK|lang_en|Angry_Birds_POP!|Angry Birds POP!]] for a limited time, and also in a special tournament in the game [[LINK|lang_en|Angry_Birds_Friends|Angry Birds Friends]] after a few weeks. On 15 October 2015, [[LINK|lang_en|Love_Rocks_starring_Shakira|Love Rocks starring Shakira]] was the first video game that featured the pop star.[[CITE|157|http://www.adweek.com/socialtimes/rovio-launches-love-rocks-starring-shakira-on-ios-android/628336]]

On 14 August 2015, at [[LINK|lang_en|Disney|Disney]]'s D23 Expo, it was announced that Shakira would play a character in the Disney animated movie *[[LINK|lang_en|Zootopia|Zootopia]];* in it, she would give voice to Gazelle, the biggest pop star in Zootopia. Shakira also contributed an original song to the film, titled "[[LINK|lang_en|Try_Everything|Try Everything]]", which was written and composed by [[LINK|lang_en|Sia_Furler|Sia]] and [[LINK|lang_en|Stargate_(production_team)|Stargate]].[[CITE|158|http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/shakira-joins-voice-cast-disney-815586]][[CITE|159|http://blogs.disney.com/disney-playlist/2015/08/14/this-news-dont-lie-shakira-is-coming-to-a-disney-movie-near-you/]] The film received universal critical acclaim with praise directed toward its animation, voice cast, characters, humor, screenplay, and themes about discrimination and social stereotypes.[[CITE|160|https://www.rollingstone.com/movies/reviews/zootopia-20160303]][[CITE|161|http://www.ibtimes.com/anti-racist-zootopia-crushing-it-countries-where-diversity-often-doesnt-play-2350849]] It opened to a record-breaking box office success in several countries and earned a worldwide gross of over $1 billion, making it the [[LINK|lang_en|2016_in_film|fourth highest-grossing film of 2016]] and the [[LINK|lang_en|List_of_highest-grossing_films|40th highest-grossing film of all time]]. The film was chosen by the [[LINK|lang_en|American_Film_Institute|American Film Institute]] as one of the [[LINK|lang_en|American_Film_Institute_Awards_2016|top ten films of 2016]].[[CITE|162|http://deadline.com/2016/12/afi-awards-film-2016-list-silence-sully-zootopia-1201867080/]]
Philanthropy and Politics

In 1997, Shakira founded the [[LINK|lang_en|Pies_Descalzos_Foundation|Pies Descalzos Foundation]], a Colombian charity with special schools for poor children all around Colombia. It was funded by Shakira and other international groups and individuals. The name of the foundation was taken from Shakira's third studio album, *[[LINK|lang_en|Pies_Descalzos|Pies Descalzos]]*, which she released in 1995. The foundation's main focus is on aid through education, and the organization has five schools across Colombia that provide education and meals for 4,000 children.[[CITE|163|http://www.fundacionpiesdescalzos.com/en/projects/the-schools.html]]
On 27 April 2014 Shakira was honored with the Hero Award at the [[LINK|lang_en|2014_Radio_Disney_Music_Awards|Radio Disney Music Awards]] for her Fundación Pies Descalzos work.[[CITE|164|http://www.onenewspage.us/n/Entertainment/750ebsjkv/Shakira-Hero-Award-Winner-at-Radio-Disney-Music.htm]]

Shakira is a [[LINK|lang_en|UNICEF_Goodwill_Ambassador|UNICEF Goodwill Ambassador]] and is one of their global representatives. On 3 April 2006, Shakira was honored at a UN ceremony for creating the Pies Descalzos Foundation.[[CITE|165|http://www.teenpeople.com/teenpeople/article/0,22196,1179900,00.shtml]] In March 2010, she was awarded a medal by the UN [[LINK|lang_en|International_Labour_Organization|International Labour Organization]] in recognition of being, as UN Labour Chief Juan Somavia put it, a "true ambassador for children and young people, for quality education and social justice".[[CITE|166|http://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/breaking-news/entertainment/shakira-honoured-by-united-nations-14708547.html]] In November 2010, after performing as the opening act of the [[LINK|lang_en|MTV_European_Music_Awards|MTV European Music Awards]], the Colombian singer also received the MTV [[LINK|lang_en|Free_Your_Mind_(MTV_award)|Free Your Mind]] award for her continuing dedication to improve access to education for all children around the world.[[CITE|167|http://ema.mtv.tv/news/free-your-mind]]

In February 2011, the [[LINK|lang_en|FC_Barcelona|FC Barcelona]] Foundation and *Pies descalzos* reached an agreement for children's education through sport.[[CITE|168|http://www.elmundodeportivo.es/gen/20110301/54120744361/noticia/el-barsa-llega-a-un-acuerdo-solidario-con-shakira.html]]
Shakira was honored at the [[LINK|lang_en|Latin_Grammys|Latin Grammys]] as the [[LINK|lang_en|Latin_Recording_Academy_Person_of_the_Year|Latin Recording Academy Person of the Year]] on 9 November 2011, for her philanthropy and contributions to Latin Music.[[CITE|169|http://www.grammy.com/news/shakira-named-latin-recording-academy-person-of-the-year]]

In October 2010, Shakira expressed disagreement with French president, [[LINK|lang_en|Nicolas_Sarkozy|Nicolás Sarkozy]], and his policy of expelling [[LINK|lang_en|Romani_people_in_Romania|Romanian gypsies]] from the country.[[CITE|170|https://portal.issn.org/resource/ISSN/0362-4331]] In the Spanish edition of the magazine *[[LINK|lang_en|GQ|GQ]]*, she also directed a few words to Sarkozy, "We are all [[LINK|lang_en|Gitanos|gypsies]]". In the interview she made her viewpoint very clear: “What is happening now to them (the gypsies) will happen to our children and our children’s children. We must turn to our citizens to act for the fundamental rights of human beings and condemn all that seems to us indictable”, she declared.[[CITE|171|http://www.elreferente.es/actualidad/shakira-a-sarkozy-todos-somos-gitanos-10574]]

On 2 November 2018, during a visit to her birthplace, [[LINK|lang_en|Barranquilla|Barranquilla]], for the construction of a school through her [[LINK|lang_en|Barefoot_Foundation|Barefoot Foundation]] (Pies Descalzos Foundation), Shakira spoke about the educational policies of the government under [[LINK|lang_en|Iv%C3%A1n_Duque_M%C3%A1rquez|Ivan Duque]] (President of [[LINK|lang_en|Colombia|Colombia]],[[CITE|172|http://eds.b.ebscohost.com.erl.lib.byu.edu/eds/detail/detail?vid=0&sid=5b76f492-10a1-4fc6-9119-2a77e50dff78%40pdc-v-sessmgr05&bdata=JnNpdGU9ZWRzLWxpdmUmc2NvcGU9c2l0ZQ%3d%3d]] 2018–2022). Speaking against the government's intentions to reduce the national education budget from 13% to 7%, she said, "This is unacceptable. It shows that instead of progressing forward we are moving backward. We need to invest more in education and we need to build more schools in places where there are none". She also talked about social inequality and [[LINK|lang_en|Unschooling|unschooling]].[[CITE|173|https://www.elheraldo.co/entretenimiento/shakira-reclama-al-gobierno-por-presupuesto-para-la-educacion-561554]]

caption.text: Shakira, [[LINK|lang_en|Alejandro_Sanz|Alejandro Sanz]] and [[LINK|lang_en|Juan_Carlos_I_of_Spain|Juan Carlos I, The King of Spain]] during the Ibero-American Summit of [[LINK|lang_en|El_Salvador|El Salvador]]

items.text: Personal life

Shakira began a relationship with Argentine lawyer [[LINK|lang_en|Antonio_de_la_R%C3%BAa|Antonio de la Rúa]] in 2000. In a 2009 interview, Shakira stated their relationship already worked as a married couple, and that "they don't need papers for that".[[CITE|174|https://www.usatoday.com/life/people/2009-07-29-shakira_N.htm]]

After 11 years together, Shakira and de la Rúa separated in August 2010 in what she described as "a mutual decision to take time apart from our romantic relationship". She wrote that the couple "view this period of separation as temporary", with de la Rúa overseeing Shakira's "business and career interests as he has always done".[[CITE|175|http://archive.shakira.com/news/title/france-11011]] As first reported in September 2012,[[CITE|176|http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/09/06/antonio-de-la-rua-sues-shakira_n_1859324.html]] de la Rúa sued Shakira in April 2013, asking for $100 million he believed he was owed after Shakira suddenly terminated her business partnership with him in October 2011.[[CITE|177|http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/thr-esq/shakira-sued-100-million-by-438840]] His lawsuit was dismissed by a [[LINK|lang_en|Los_Angeles_County_Superior_Court|Los Angeles County Superior Court]] judge in August 2013.[[CITE|178|http://www.eonline.com/uk/news/445207/shakira-wins-ex-boyfriend-s-lawsuit-dismissed-singer-could-not-be-happier-now]]

Shakira entered a relationship with the Spanish football player [[LINK|lang_en|Gerard_Piqu%C3%A9|Gerard Piqué]], [[LINK|lang_en|Centre_half|centre back]] for [[LINK|lang_en|FC_Barcelona|FC Barcelona]] and the [[LINK|lang_en|Spanish_national_football_team|Spanish national team]] in 2011.[[CITE|179|http://www.tribalfootball.com/articles/pique-confirms-shakira-relationship-request-barcelona-coach-guardiola-1434891]][[CITE|180|http://www.whoateallthepies.tv/babes/55349/wag-affair-gerard-pique-and-shakira-spotted-together-again.html]] Piqué, who is exactly ten years her junior, first met Shakira in the spring of 2010, when he appeared in the music video for Shakira's song "[[LINK|lang_en|Waka_Waka_(This_Time_for_Africa)|Waka Waka (This Time for Africa)]]", the official song of the [[LINK|lang_en|2010_FIFA_World_Cup|2010 FIFA World Cup]].[[CITE|176|http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/09/06/antonio-de-la-rua-sues-shakira_n_1859324.html]] Shakira gave birth to the couple's first son on 22 January 2013 in [[LINK|lang_en|Barcelona|Barcelona]], Spain, where the family had taken up residence.[[CITE|181|http://nbclatino.com/2013/01/22/shakira-welcomes-baby-boy-milan-pique-mebarak/]] Shakira gave birth to their second son on 29 January 2015.[[CITE|182|http://www.shakira.com/news/835]]
